author: Reuters
title: UPDATE 1-South Africa plans to overhaul power grid to stem shortages - Eskom
text:
(Adds details, Quote: s)
JOHANNESBURG Oct 16 (Reuters) - South Africa will spend 6 billion rand ($456 million) to strengthen its transmission grid this year as it seeks to end power shortages that are slowing growth in Africa's most advanced economy, Eskom said on Friday.
South Africa is investing heavily in power generation projects to stem chronic shortages but some of this electricity is lost due to an ageing and neglected power grid.
Eskom is spend 60 billion rand a year on improving electricity infrastructure, Eskom CEO Brian Molefe said while presenting a ten year plan to build 10,000 kilometres of high voltage power lines.
The cash-strapped utility has had to limit is grid expansion for the 2015-2016 financial year but a senior planner said he was confident that the it would be able to raise funds to meet its future expansion plans.
"Capital is an issue but we can overcome it," Leslie Naidoo, Eskom's senior manager for infrastructure investment planning said.
He said acquiring land adjacent to transmission lines was a bigger problem then securing funding.
($1 = 13.15 rand) (Reporting by Peroshni Govender ; Editing by James Macharia and Joe Brock)
